title: Log of the Euterpe. Volume 14, 1902-1904.
note_text: This log contains corresponding information to A0245.1.13. This entire log features extremely obscure handwritten entries with numerous misspellings, making it very hard to read.

title: Letter, Reuben Gatward to Polly : life on the goldfields.
note_text: The letter is written on a wrapper for 'The Polygot Newsletter, a Summary in English, French, German and Spanish, for Transmission to Europe'. The Polygot was printed and published for the proprietors at the 'Punch' Office, Melbourne, October 1858. The wrapper has an etching of 'View on the Yarra near Dight's Mills' by F. Grusse on the front. The newsletter is an early example of a publication produced in several different languages; an indication of the 'multi-cultural' nature of the population of Victoria in the 1850s.

title: Emigration, North America and Australia, 1832 : commissioners, public offices and individuals.

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note_text: On folios 1b-2a: "... Wa-baʻd, fa-hādhihi kalimāt ... fī tashrīḥ mushkilāt al-Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ al-mansūb ilá al-Imām al-kāmil bi-Abī [Abī] ʻAbd Allāh Muḥammad, al-maʻrūf bi-Abī al-Jaysh al-Anṣārī al-Andalusī ... daʻatnī ilá taʼlīfihā ishārāt ṣadarat min Janāb al-Amīr al-muʻaẓẓam wa-al-Ṣadr al-mufakhkham ... Sulaymān Bīk ibn al-Amīr al-aʻẓam wa-al-Wazīr al-akram ... Amīr Ṭāshiḥūn Bīk ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note_text: Colophon: "... Wa-hādhā ākhir mā aradnāh min 'Bayān mushkilāt al-Mukhtaṣar fī ʻilm al-ʻarūḍ al-mawsūm bi-Andalusī', ḥāmidan wa-shākran lillāh taʻālá ʻalá ilhām al-taḥqīq wa-inʻām al-tawfīq. al-Ḥamdu lillāh wa-al-shukr la-hu ʻalá al-tamām, wa-lil-Rasūl afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Qad tamma al-kitāb bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb. Subḥāna Rabbika Rabbi al-ʻizzati ʻammā yaṣifūn, wa-salāmun ʻalá al-mursalīn, wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-ʻArūḍ al-Andalusī : manuscript / ʻAbd al-Muḥsin al-Qayṣarī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "... This is the end of what we intended to clarify of the problems of the compendium on the science of prosody, titled 'al-Andalusī'. I praise and thank God Most High for inspiring me and helping me to finish it. Praises and thanks to God for the completion. May the best prayer and peace be upon the Messenger [Prophet Muḥammad]. The book is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King. Praise be to the Lord, the Lord of Might, far is He from what they falsely attribute to Him. May peace be upon the messengers, and praise be to God Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note_text: Colophon: "Wa-wāfaqa al-farāgh min itmām hādhihi al-nuskhah al-mubārakah yawm al-Ithnayn al-mubārak, khāmis ʻashar Rabīʻ al-Awwal, min shuhūr sanat khams wa-sabʻīn wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah, ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah. Wa-ṣallá [Allāh] ʻalá man lā nabī baʻdah. Wa-kutiba bi-rasm Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, muftī al-Muslimīn, mufīd al-ṭālibīn, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Aḥmad ibn Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā al-Shaykh, al-Imām al-ʻālim al-ʻāmil al-zāhid al-wariʻ, Mawlānā al-Shaykh Ismāʻīl, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihimā fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah, wa-jaʻalahu huwa wa-salafuhu fī shafāʻat Sayyid al-Mursalīn, wa-ḥsharahumā taḥta liwāʼihi Yawm al-Qiyāmah. Innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼu qadīr, wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr. Wa-ghafara Allāh li-man saʻá fī hādhihi al-nuskhah, wa-li-kātibihā, wa-li-man naẓara fī dhālik wa-daʻā bi-khayr. Āmīn. Wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm."

title: 880-02 al-Minaḥ al-Makkīyah fī sharḥ al-Hamzīyah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn Ḥajar al-Haythamī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "This blessed copy was completed on blessed Monday, 15 Rabīʻ al-Awwal, 1075 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [6 October, 1664], may the best prayer and peace be upon him. Praise be to God alone. May [God] pray on the one who no prophet comes after him [Prophet Muḥammad]. Copied for our Master and Lord, the learned scholar, the muftī of the Muslims, the benevolent to the students, our Master Shaykh Aḥmad, the son of our Master and Lord, the learned laboror, the ascetic and righteous scholar, our Master Shaykh Ismāʻīl, may God benefit us with their blessing in this world and the Hereafter. May he and his predecessor be granted the intercession of the Master of the Messengers [Prophet Muḥammad] and be gathered under his banner on the Day of Resurrection. He [God] does what He pleases, and readily answers the requests. May God forgive whoever participated in this copy, its copyist and the reader who offers an invocation of welfare. Amen. There is no power nor might except in God the Almighty and All Powerful."

title: Liturgical book (fragment).
note_text: According to scholar Neil Harris, identifiable as the text of a Cisterican or Benedictine Breviary, 4th Sunday after Pentecost. On the front cover the text reads: "hora cene dicere inuitat <,,,> et uenirent quia omnia para <...> a sint alleluia. Benedictus deus" and on the back "Exi cito in plateas & uico <...> uitatis et pauperes ac deb <,,,> es cecos et claudos compelle". For the date, also given that it was still in Italy in quite modern times, can be safely assigned to northern or central Italy in the fifteenth century or very early sixteenth. Though the parchment is old, the binding itself is modern, i.e. early 20th century (just a bit of a falsification, probably done by Martini). The endpapers are on mechanical paper and the edges are not very scuffed. Autograph "J. Martini" of Giuseppe Martini on front paste-down. Manuscript notes (of Martini?) on free front endpaper.

title: Narrative of a miracle fragment.
note_text: Two columns. Some nomina sacra. Black and red ink. One-half page extant. Potential reference to Revelation. Ink is well preserved on recto, but not on verso.

title: Liturgical book fragments.
note_text: Three different texts or sections of texts: pp. 1r-4v, 4v-7v, 8r-12v. Minimal marginalia. Common use of nomina sacra, with some unidentified figures: KD the presbyter and TB the apostle. Mention of multiple Christian figures.

title: Bible: Apocalypse of John.
note_text: Recto contains Rev 8:8-9:2. Verso contains Rev 9:2-9. Coptic numeration suggest that this is page 304 on the verso. Minor marginalia. Attatched fragment of paper contains some Arabic script.

title: Psalmodia.
note_text: Coptic numeration suggests that some pages are missing, with some out of order. Contains prayers of thanksgiving, call-and-response sections between the deacon and priest, and stock hymns to "Abba NIM" (34v). Some section titles include "Anaphora of the holy king," "On the pope," "On peace," "Proem of the division."

title: Liturgical texts and doxologies.
note_text: Pages are not in order. Some repairs to damaged pages. Vol. 1 = Contains titles: "Gospel of Luke" and "Psalm 131." Contains passages from Luke, Acts, John, as well as fragments of a crowning liturgical text. Some exposition on water, blood, and Spirit. Multiple rubrications appear to be intentionally blotted out. Vol. 2 = Emphasis on Anthony, Elijah, Mary, Christ, David, and Solomon. Some pages stuck together. On one page (12v), St. Cyril's name is stricken and replaced by Teoskoros (Dioscorus of Alexandria?).

title: Collection of liturgical texts.
note_text: Some Arabic titles and full pages interspersed. Fragment of an additional Arabic text. Mentions David, Mary, Gabriel, Zechariah. 1v bears similarities to Luke 1:67-80. Some titles include "Psalm," "Gospel of Luke," "Paul: Romans," and "Catholic: 2 John."

title: Fragments of Liturgy of St. Basil and Liturgy of St. Gregory.
note_text: Contains fragments of Liturgy of St. Basil and Liturgy of St. Gregory. Pages are severly disordered based on internal numeration. Pages are fairly stained with wax. Many versi have extra letters written in the lower right-hand corner. Some pages stuck together. Contains references to a "song of Moses" and other songs. Include praises of Abba Macarius.

title: Euchologion.
note_text: Coptic text with Arabic translation. Light marginalia and later redactions. Multiple pages have letters on the bottom center of the verso. 43v contains a large pink cross in the margin, as well as red stains.

title: Liturgy of the Coptic Jacobites.
note_text: Contains the Liturgy of the Coptic Jacobite with Anaphora of St. Cyril, which was originally a 6th century text attributed to Jacob Baradaeus, bishop of Edessa. Some pages missing. Non-alphabetic Coptic numeration reveal that pages are mostly in the 200s. Numeration occurred after emendation of text. Multiple pages are repaired by scraps of other paper.

title: Collection of hymns and prayers.
note_text: Contains hymns to the Virgin Mary and Prayer of Reconciliation to the Son from St. George's Liturgy. Coptic numeration suggests that text is out of order. Multiple texts of varying page sizes bound together. Some redaction and omission. Minimal marginalia.

title: Bible: 1 John, Selections.
note_text: Recto contains 1 John 2:27-3:2, 4:16-20. Verso contains 1 John 3:5-9, 4:20-5:2, 5:4-6. Coptic numeration suggests this leaf is page 178 of MS. Two (potentially four) columns.

title: Bible: Genesis.
note_text: Contains Gen 24:1-14. Coptic numeration suggests this leaf is page 76 of MS. Some marginalia. Parchment has many folds, but is well preserved.

title: Great Lent and Easter Lectionary.
note_text: Contains lectionary readings for Sundays and feast days from the first Sunday of Lent to the beginning of Easter; also contains 13 leaves from the Annual lectionary for the month of Mesori (July-August), calendar of the Coptic Church from 22-27 Paopi (October-November), and leaves from a history of the Alexandrian patriarchs.

title: Carthusian Psalter with Canticles and Creed.
note_text: Incomplete. Text ends with Psalm 77.

title: Indenture placing John Dikes into the service of John Morris, joiner.
note_text: At the head of the indenture is an engraved allegorical triptych. The center panel features a depiction of George III. At left, a young female student stands in front of "the Pillar of Faith" and bears a sign reading "And we as mothers of our Israel." At right, a young male student stands in front of "the Gate of Life" and bears a sign reading "In cause of Church & State may we Excell."

title: Epistolae Paulae et Catholicae.
note_text: Text on final verso identified as a spell or incantation in facing note in a later hand.

title: Discourses.
note_text: White Monastery codex ZD, pp. 193-200. Black ink. Most text is well-preserved; some pages are faded. Two columns per page. Lack of decoration/rubrication. Small fragment contains ink, but no discernible letters. Leaf 1, r = Theological exposition concerning the cross and idolatry with a quotation from Ps 97:7. Leaf 1, v = Mentions heaven and the fires of Gehenna. Leaf 2, r = Mentions a mountain or monastery (ptoou), the sea, and potentially an entourage (komitaton). Leaf 2, v = Coptic page numeration: 198. Mentions a king, the Lord, and land, and sin. Also mentions “those who know the apostles say this: 'God [is] in Christ, who reconciles the world to him.' The interpretation of these things...those who hear me a few times in the midst of every crowd.” Leaf 3, v = Mentions a synagogue and a discourse ("I answered, saying to them: 'It is good...'"). Leaf 4, r = Discourse on "lift[ing] up our cross" and endless prayer. Mentions the kingdom of Christ. Leaf 4, v = Mentions the Lord, grace/gift, a procession out, and "the one who made them."

title: Canon.
note_text: Black ink. Two columns. Recto is well-preserved; verso is faded. Some minor lacunae. The text is from Codex XF of the White Monastery, including text from Shenoute's Canon 6. Recto focuses on the commandment of God, with a reference to the "gospel of God" and "brothers." Verso focuses on God's teaching and Satan.

title: Bible: Revelation
note_text: Black, red, and green ink. Some binding repairs with reused Arabic texts. Final half of book suffers from water staining. Coptic numeration = pp. 12-130 + p. 153. ff. 1-5 = Liturgical text, including prayers and praises of bishops. Use of Abba NIM ("Father so-and-so") as a stock phrase that can be filled in by any episcopal leader. Mentions Jerusalem as the metropolis; mentions the Book of Life. Potential title = the chiliographon (thousand-writer?). ff. 6-103 = Revelation (titled: The Unveiling of What He Saw, namely, of John the Evangelist). Rubrication and decorative headpieces to mark off John's seven "letters" to the churches of Asia. Missing pages (via Coptic numeration) = 20, 60, 74-75, 77, 81, 90-100, 121-152. Corresponds to lacking Rev 1:8-11, 7:11-14, 10:1-7, 10-11:1, 11-13, 13:1-14:15, 19:12- 22:21. Some letter headings contain marginalia saying "Answer: ..." = Call-and-response? Coptic marginalia in pencil (f. 58). 104r = "He said this, which testifies to these things, namely, that they will occur and that they are coming soon. Come, Lord Jesus Christ, upon all the saints from age to age. Amen." MS concludes with seven pages (4 ff.) of Arabic text.

title: Bible: Isaiah.
note_text: Black and red ink. Significant staining on leaves 2 and 3. Fiber backing used to support ff. Folio 1 preserves only one column per side; leaves 2-3 preserve two columns. Folio 1 contains a narrative about grapes, cutting, the Lord of Hosts, Judea (1r); strong drink, a cithara, a psaltery, and wine (1v). Folio 2 contains a narrative about eating and drinking, those whom God remembers, divine judgment (2r); and Isaiah 24:4-15 (2v). Folio 3 contains Isaiah 40:2-20.

title: Early Christian narrative.
note_text: Some rubrication and decoration. Some spots have letters of a different ink -- perhaps a palimpsest. Two columns. References to Theodorus (of Tabennese?). Coptic numeration suggests this is p. 15-16 of its MS. Substantial staining to half of folio. Recto references a presbyter, frank speech, John, Theodo[rus?], and an elder. Verso references [Theo]dorus.

title: Theological discourse.
note_text: Repairs to top of folio; majority of the folio preserved. Significant wax staining on verso. Two columns. Recto = Theological discourse concerning Jesus and the “Day of the Lord.” Also mentions the “poor brothers.” Verso = Theological discourse on women, their dangers to men, and adornment of the body.

title: Various Coptic fragments.
note_text: Black and red ink. Significant staining on some fragments. Frag. 1 = Only discernible word is "misfortune" (v). Frag. 2 = Recto contains the Coptic page numeration 15; verso is marked as page 16. r = "his exaltedness...and I was...a laughing thing...for in the...exaltedness...testimony...from...virgin..." v = "tread upon...woman...the king of...was able...woman...was able...up to...the one who..." Frag. 3 = Little extant text. Frag. 4 = Page numeration included: 128. Appears to be a palimpsest, with a nomen sacrum XC ("Christ") mostly faded on recto. r = "from...that...weep and..." v = "and you did not...you should not look at...for we..." Frag. 5 = Little extant text. Frag. 6 = Very stained. Small script. r = "when...when...them...him..." v = No discernible words. Frag. 7 = Text only on recto, but too faded to discern words. Frag. 8 = Recto contains fragment of a title page of a Bohairic liturgical text. r = "people..." v = "...Gabriel the angel proclaimed..." Frag. 9 = Fragment of a Bohairic liturgical text. References liturgical blessing.

title: Bible: Psalms.
note_text: Black, red, green, and yellow ink. Script of verso is faded; recto is well-preserved. r = Fragment of Psalm 23:2-4. "...green...he...my soul. He took the road...the paths of the righteous...his name...walk in the middle of shadow." v = Fragment of Psalm 24:7-9. "the king of...to...the lord...the lord...in the battle...lift..."

title: Historia calamitatum and epistolae.
note_text: Manuscript is incomplete (circa 50 leaves missing?). Text opens: id secreto fieret (Historia calamitatum). Text concludes: orationum instantiam confessio[ne]m lau[dis?] (Letter 7).

title: Lettres de monseigneur Antoine Girard, evesque de Poitiers : à diferentes personnes qu'il conduisait : manuscript.
note_text: Seven pages of prayers in a different contemporary hand at the end of the volume.

title: 880-02 Barīqah Maḥmūdīyah fī sharḥ Ṭarīqah Muḥammadīyah wa-sharīʻah Nabawīyah fī sīrah Aḥmadīyah. Al-Jild 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khādimī.
note_text: Colophon: "Intahá al-juzʼ al-awwal taḥrīran fī sanat thamān wa-miʼatayn baʻda al-alf thumma yatlūhu al-juzʼ al-thānī, awwaluhu: al-Ṣinf al-awwal fī munkarāt al-qalb, al-munkarāt al-ṣādirah min al-qalb wa-āfātuh ay al-balīyah al-mutarattibah ʻalayh. Wa-yalīhi al-juzʼ al-thālith, awwaluhu al-khāmis wa-al-thalāthūn min al-sittīn, al-Faẓāẓah wa-ghilẓat al-qalb wa-bihi yatimmu al-kitāb min Sharḥ al-Ṭarīqah li-Mawlānā Muḥammad al-Birkawī wa-sharḥuhu li-Ustādhinā Muḥammad al-Khādimī, ṭayyaba Allāh tharāhumā wa-jaʻala al-Jannah mathwāhumā. Allāhumma infaʻnā bi-ʻulūmihimā bi-ḥurmat aslāfihimā wa-irfaʻ darajātinā fī aʻlá ʻillīyīn wa-iḥshirnā maʻa al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn. Āmīn. Wa-salām ʻalá al-mursalīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Wa-anā al-ḥaqīr al-faqīr [...] ibn Ḥasan ibn [...] al-shahīr bi-Ḥaqdārʹzādah yassara Allāh lahum al-ḥusná wa-al-ziyādah. Āmīn. Bi-jāh al-Karīm al-Amīn ṣallá Allāh taʻālá ʻalayhi wa-sallam."

title: 880-02 Barīqah Maḥmūdīyah fī sharḥ Ṭarīqah Muḥammadīyah wa-sharīʻah Nabawīyah fī sīrah Aḥmadīyah. Al-Jild 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muṣṭafá al-Khādimī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "The copying of the first part has ended in the year 1208 [1793/1794]. It will be followed by the second part which begins with the first section on the abominations of the heart, that is the abominations that eminate from the heart and its ailments, i.e. the predicament that affects it. It will be follwed by the third part which begins with the thirty fifth of the sixty sections: Rudness and bluntness of the heart and by that the book of Sharḥ al-Ṭarīqah [al-Muḥammadīyah] of our master Muḥammad al-Birkawī and the commentary on it by our teacher Muḥammad al-Khādimī is concluded. May God bless their resting place and make Paradise their abode. May God benefit us by their knowledge by the intercession of their predecessors. We beseech God to raise our ranks to the highest hights and to gather us with the prophets, the righteous, the martyrs and the virtuous. Amen. Peace be unto the messengers. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. I, the despised and poor [...] ibn Ḥasan ibn [...] known as Ḥaqdārʹzādah, May God grant them the best end and more. Amen, by the intercession of the Benevolent and Faithful One, May God pray on him and give him peace.

title: 880-02 al-Kashf al-mujallī li-kalām al-Minhāj wa-al-shāriḥ al-Maḥallī : manuscript / ʻAlī al-Munīrī.
note_text: Ends with: "... qāla Ibn al-ʻImād wa-hādhā lā yunāfī ittifāq al-ʻulamāʼ ʻalá anna min aḥkām al-īmān al-ʻazm ʻalá fiʻl al-wājibāt fī al-mustaqbal li-anna maḥalla [then, in a different hand] li-anna maḥalla maḥalla ʻumūm al-ʻilm wa-al-fiqh wa-jāmiʻ maʻānīh Jalāl al-Dīn al-Maḥallī raḍiya Allāh ʻanh. Wa-sammaytuhu bi-Kitāb al-Minhāj al-jalīs fī al-fiqh wa-jaʻaltuhu kāmil al-maʻānī wa-kāna intihāʼ [al-intihāʼ] fī sanat 1148, alf wa-miʼah thamāniyah wa-arbaʻūn Hijrīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh dāyim al-salām."

title: 880-02 al-Jawāhir al-ʻiẓām fī waqf Ḥamzah wa-Hishām : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Munayyir al-Samānūdī.
note_text: Colophon: "Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh ʻalá al-tamām. Wa-al-maṭlūb mimman iṭṭalaʻa ʻalá hādhā al-taʼlīf an yanẓura fīhi bi-ʻayn al-riḍá wa-al-inṣāf lā bi-ʻayn al-sukhṭ wa-al-ijḥāf wa-in wajada fīhi khaṭaʼ aṣlaḥahu aw ʻayban satarahu wa-an yadraʼa bi-al-ḥasanah al-sayiʼah fa-qad qalla muʼallif an yaslama min al-hafawāt aw yanjwa muṣannif min al-ʻatharāt li-anna al-insān yaḥullu bi-hi al-khaṭaʼ wa-al-nisyān khuṣūṣan fī hādhā al-zamān alladhī kathurat fīhi al-shawāghil wa-al-humūm wa-ʻaẓumat fīhi al-qawāṭiʻ wa-al-ghumūm, nasʼalu Allāh an yunajjīnā min āfātih wa-an yaqīnā min tabiʻātih wa-an yumītanā ʻalá ḥifẓ Kitābih wa-an yuwaffiqanā li-ḍabṭihi wa-ṣawābih wa-an yamanna ʻalaynā wa-ikhwāninā bi-al-mawt ʻalá al-Islām wa-an yulḥiqanā bi-mashāyikhinā al-bararah al-kirām wa-lā ḥawla wa-lā qūwata illā billāh al-ʻAlī al-ʻAẓīm wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad khātim al-nabīyīn wa-al-mursalīn wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn. Āmīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min jamʻihi yawm al-Ithnayn khāmis wa-ʻishrīn Shawwāl sanat thamāniyah wa-sittīn wa-miʼah wa-alf min al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah 1168."

title: 880-02 al-Jawāhir al-ʻiẓām fī waqf Ḥamzah wa-Hishām : manuscript / Muḥammad al-Munayyir al-Samānūdī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "Praise be to God on finishing [the book]. It is requested that those who look into this composition to judge it with compassion and justice not with discontent and prejudice and if they see in it any mistake to correct it, or a blemish to cover it and to hide the bad with the good because no author is immune from making mistakes or writer from shortcomings because human beings are prone to mistakes and forgetfulness specially in this time in which concerns and worries have increased and calamities and sorrows are enormous. We ask God to deliver us from its disasters and to protect us from its implications and that we die protecting His Book and to grnat us to be able to keep it safe and sound and that He may make us and our brethren die as Muslims that we may follow in the path of our rightious and honorable masters. There is no power nor might except in God the most high and the most exalted. May God pray on our master Muḥammad the seal of the prophets and messengers and on his family and all his companions. Amen. The composition of this book was completed on Monday the twenty fifth of Shawwal, the year 1168 of the Hijrah [4 August, 1755]."

title: 880-02 Risālah fī ʻilm al-waḍʻ : manuscript / Mūsá al-Sūsī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālah fī ʻilm al-waḍʻ taʼlīf al-ʻallāmah wa-al-muḥaqqiq al-fahhāmah Shykhunā al-Shaykh Mūsá al-Sūsī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi. Āmīn. M."

title: 880-02 Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Nūbī.
note_text: Incipit missing, starts with: "... fī al-aḥkām al-khamsah allatī hiya al-ījāb wa-al-nadb wa-al-ibāḥah wa-al-karāhah wa-al-taḥrīm wa-ammā al-bāb al-thālith min abwāb uṣūl al-fiqh fa-huwa al-ʻāmm wa-al-khāṣṣ wa-yudhkaru fīhi al-muṭlaq wa-al-muqayyad wa-al-muḥtamal wa-al-mubayyan wa-al-ẓāhir wa-al-muʼawwal wa-qad ittafaqa al-ʻulamāʼ ʻalá anna al-ʻumūm min ʻawāriḍ al-alfāẓ ḥaqīqah wa-fī al-maʻná aqwāl aṣaḥḥuhā annahu ḥaqīqah ayḍan li-anna al-ʻumūm fī al-lughah huwa al-shumūl ..."

title: 880-02 Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Nūbī.
note_text: Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā yassarahu Allāh taʻālá min Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt fa-asʼalu Allāh Rabb al-Araḍīn wa-al-samāwāt an yanfaʻa bi-hi ka-mā nafaʻa bi-aṣlihi innahu samīʻ qarīb mujīb al-daʻawāt. Qāla muʼallifuhu, ghafar Allāh la-hu: Wa-kāna dhālika ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi aḥqar al-makhlūqāt Aḥmad al-Nūbī, ghafara Allāh la-hu mā iqtarafahu min al-dhunūb wa-al-zallāt fī awākhir shahr Rajab al-fard min shuhūr sanat arbaʻīn wa-alf. Khatama Allāh aʻmālanā wa-aʻmāl al-muʼminīn bi-al-ṣāliḥāt. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn."

title: 880-02 Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt : manuscript / Aḥmad al-Nūbī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what God, May He be exalted, facilitated of "Tawḍīḥ al-Waraqāt." I beseech God, the Lord of heaven and earth that we benefit from it as we benefited from its origin; He listens and readily answers the invocations. Its author, May God forgive him, said: The book was written by its compiler, the most despised of creatures, Aḥmad al-Nūbī, May God forgive him what he commited of sins and shortcomings, at the end of the month of Rajab al-Fard of the year 1040, May God conclude our deeds and the deeds of the believers with righteousness. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe."

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb ka-mā akhbara bi-dhālika al-ṣādiq al-maṣdūq ʻalayhi al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-ʻalá ālihi al-aʻlām. M.M.M. taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah al-Shaykh Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Saʻdīnī baldatan al-Ashʻārī ṭarīqatan taghammadahu Allāh bi-raḥmatih wa-askanahu fasīḥ jannatih innahu ʻalá mā yashāʼ qadīr wa-bi-al-ijābah jadīr wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn".

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note_text: On folio 497b an endowment statement: "Waqafa wa-ḥabasa lillāh taʻālá hādhā al-kitāb al-faqīr al-muqirr bi-al-dhanb wa-al-taqṣīr Yāsīn Makhlūf ʻalá ṭalabat al-ʻilm wa-jaʻala al-naẓar fīhi li-awlādihi baʻda wafātihi lā yubāʻu wa-lā yūhabu wa-lā yurhanu fa-man baddalahu baʻda mā samiʻahu fa-innamā ithmuhu ʻalá alladhīna yubaddilūnahu. Inna Allāh samīʻ ʻalīm. Kātibuhu al-faqīr Ḥusayn Saʻfān shākiran lillāh al-Raḥīm al-Raḥmān. Wa-al-Ḥamdu lillāh ʻlá kull ḥāll. Tamm."

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note_text: Colophon (folio 496b-folio 497a): "Wa-qad tamma hādhā al-kitāb bi-ḥamd Allāh al-Malik al-Wahhāb ʻalá yad jāmiʻihi faqīr ʻafw rabbihi Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Saʻdīnī baldatan al-Shāfiʻī madhhaban al-Ashʻārī ṭarīqatan. Wa-nasʼalu Allāh al-karīm bi-jāh Muḥammad ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam an yajʻalanā wa-mashāyikhinā wa-muḥibbīnā wa-kātib hādhih al-nuskhah maʻa alladhīna anʻama Allāh ʻlayhim min al-nabīyīn wa-al-ṣiddīqīn wa-al-shuhadāʼ wa-al-ṣāliḥīn wa-ḥasuna ulāʼika rafīqan wa-an yasturanā bi-sitrihi al-jamīl wa-an yuyassira lanā umūranā maʻa al-rāḥah li-qulūbinā wa-abdāninā fa-innahu mujīb al-duʻāʼ wa-lā yaruddu man qaṣadahu wa-iʻtamada ʻlayhi wa-fawwaḍa amarahu ilayhi. Wa-qad tawassalnā fī qabūl duʻāʼinā bi-jāh Rasūl Allāh ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam li-qawlihi ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Tawassalū bi-jāhī fa-inna jāhī ʻinda Allāh ʻaẓīm. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min taʼlīf hādhā al-kitāb yawm al-Jumʻah ʻishrīn shahr Rabīʻ Awwal sanat 1293 (GhRJṢ) alf wa-miʼatayn thalāthah wa-tisʻīn baʻda al-Hijrah al-Nabawīyah ʻalá ṣāḥibihā afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-salām wa-azká al-taḥīyah wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

title: 880-02 Fatʹḥ al-bāb fī hawl yawm al-maʼāb wa-al-ʻarḍ ʻalá Rabb al-Arbāb : manuscript / Yāsīn Makhlūf.
note_text: Translation of the colophon (folio 496b-folio 497a): "This book is concluded by the praise of God the Benevolent King at the hand of its compiler Yāsīn Makhlūf al-Saʻdīnī (by town), al-Shāfiʻi (by school), al-Ashʻarī (by Ṣufī order). We beseech God by the exalted status of Muḥammad, may God pray on him and grant him peace, to gather us, our masters, our loved ones and the author of this copy with those whom God favored of the prophets, the rightious, the martyrs and the virtuous (What good companions those are!) and to protect us with his pleasant cover and to facilitate our matters with rest to our hearts and bodies because He answers invocation and does not turn back he who seeks Him, depends on Him and consigns himself to Him. We beseech God to accept our invokation by the status of the Messenger of God, May God pray on him and grant him peace beause he said: Beseech God in my status because my status is exalted with God. The writing of this book was concluded on Friday the twentieth of the month of Rabīʻ al-Awwal, the year 1293 (GhRJṢ [in alphabetical rconning]) of the Prophetic Hijrah, the best of prayer and peace and the most fragrant greetings be upon its originator. May God pray on our master Muḥammad, his family and his companions and grant them peace. Amen. Amen. Amen. Praise be to God the Lord of the Universe. It is concluded.

title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Shamāʼil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Kitāb al-Shamāʼil lil-Shaykh al-Imām al-ḥāfiẓ al-ruḥalah al-Tirmidhī raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá ibn sūrah ibn Mūsá ibn al-Ḍaḥḥāk al-Sulamī aḥad al-aʼimmah alladhīn yuqtadá bihim fī ʻilm al-Ḥadīth, kāna yuḍrab bi-hi al-mathal, raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu. Āmīn".

title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Shamāʼil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī.
note_text: On folio 1a: Table of contents in 35 chapters.

title: 880-03 Kitāb al-Shamāʼil : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn ʻĪsá al-Tirmidhī.
note_text: Colophon: Colophon missing; text ends abruptly with: "... wa-kāna min sīratihi fī juzʼ al-ummah īthār ahl al-faḍl bi-idhnih wa-qismuhu ʻalá qadr faḍlihim fī al-dīn ..."

title: Letter : to George Augustus Frederick, Prince of Wales, 1796 May 6.
note_text: Signed "C" and dated "6 Mai 1796" on p. [3].

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
note_text: Colophon: "Qad tammat qiṣṣat ḥayāt al-Qiddīs al-ʻaẓīm wa-al-ṭūbāwī Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī wa-al-muʻallim al-Ilāhī bi-qalam mutarjimihā min al-lughah al-Suryānīyah ilá al-lughah al-ʻArabīyah Buṭrus Rizq al-ʻAndārī aḥad talāmidhat Madrasat Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn wa-kāna dhālika fī al-dayr al-madhkūr fa-yarjū ghaḍḍ al-naẓar min kull labīb wa-adīb ʻammā faraṭa minhu al-khaṭaʼ siwá kāna min al-imlāʼ am min tarkīb al-jumal fa-subḥān man huwa maʻṣūm faqaṭ. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhā al-kutayyib fī 17 K 2 [Kānūn al-Thānī] sanat 1895 Masīḥīyah. Fa-Allāh yuʻṭīnā an naʻīsha ka-hādhā al-Qiddīs al-ʻaẓīm wa-natamaththal wa-naqtadī bi-ḥayātihi al-mamlūwah qadāsah. Fa-hādhā mā aṭlubuhu wa-atamannāh bi-shafāʻat Sayyidat al-ʻĀlamīn wa-bi-ṣalāt al-ṭūbāwī Mārī Afrām wa-Mārī Mārūn wa-Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn wa-jamīʻ al-qiddīsīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-01 Ḥayāt al-Qiddīs Mārī Afrām al-Suryānī : manuscript.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "The biography of the great blessed and divine teacher Saint Ephrem the Syrian is completed by its translator from Syriac into Arabic Buṭrus Rizq al-ʻAndārī, a student of the School of Mārī Yūḥannā Mārūn at the mentioned monastery. He requests from any intelligent and learned reader to disregard any mistake in spelling or sentence structure. Glory be to the Only Infallible One. This booklet was concluded on 17 January 1895. May God grant us to live according to the example of this great saint and emulate his holy life. This is what I am asking and hope for through the intercession of Our Lady and the prayers of the blessed Saint Ephrem, Saint Mārūn, Saint Yūḥannā Mārūn and all the saints. Amen."

title: 880-02 Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn Muḥammad al-Sunbāwī al-Amīr al-Kabīr al-Mālikī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Maṭlaʻ al-nayyirayn fīmā yataʻallaqu bi-al-qudratayn taʼlīf al-shams al-munīr Shaykhunā al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-mashhūr bi-al-Amīr nafaʻanā Allāh bi-ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad al-nabī al-ummī wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note_text: On folio 2a: "Hādhā Sharḥ al-manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-Qamar ʻafá Allāh ʻan muʼallifihā Imāminā al-muḥaqqiq al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakatihi. Āmīn. ʻĪsá Muḥammad al-Bukhārī. Sanat 1220 Hijrīyah."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note_text: Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam bi-al-ṣawāb wa-ilayhi al-marjiʻ wa-al-maʼāb wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Intahá mā wajadtuhu bi-khaṭṭ Shaykhinā waḥīd dahrihi wa-farīd ʻaṣrihi al-ʻallāmah al-fāḍil wa-al-ʻumdah al-kāmil fasaḥ Allāh fī muddatihi wa-abqāh wa-nafaʻanā bi-hi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Tamma naskh hādhihi al-risālah min nuskhat muʼallifihā al-Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī ʻalá yad rājī ʻafwa al-Bārī ʻĪsá Muḥammad Aḥmad ḥafīd al-Ustādh ʻAlī al-madʻū bi-al-Bukhārī nafaʻanā Allāh bihim. Āmīn. Tammat."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ al-Manẓūmah allatī fī manāzil al-qamar : manuscript / al-Shihāb al-Sujāʻī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "God knows the truth better. To Him is the reference and returning. May God pray on our Master and Lord Muḥammad, his family and companions and grant them peace. Concluded is what I found in handwriting of our teacher the unique of his time and the distinguished of his era the virtuous scholar and the perfect authority, may God prolong his life, protect him and benefit us and the Muslims by him. Amen. The copying of this treatise was done from the copy of its author Shaykh Aḥmad al-Sujāʻī by the hand of him who hopes for the forgiveness of the Creator ʻĪsá Muḥammad Aḥmad the grandson of the teacher ʻAlī called al-Bukhārī, may God benefit us by them. Amen. It is concluded."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyah ʻalá sharḥ al-Risālah al-ʻAḍudīyah : manuscript / Shams al-Dīn Muḥammad ibn Sālim al-Ḥifnī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Shaykh Muḥammad al-Ḥifnī al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq al-ʻālim al-mudaqqiq ḥafiẓahu Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note_text: Colophon of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": "Najazat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih ʻalá yad afqar al-ʻibād al-ḍuʻafāʼ Muṣṭafá najl al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh al-fāḍil ḥāwī al-faḍāʼil al-Shaykh ʻAlī Fayyāḍ al-Balqaṭrī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man daʻā la-hu bi-al-maghfirah wa-lil-qāriʼ wa-al-mustamiʻ wa-li-jamīʻ al-Muslimīn. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min hādhihi al-muqaddimah al-Rāʼīyah fī rasm al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm taʼlīf Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Shāṭibī, nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-aʻāda ʻalaynā wa-ʻalá al-Muslimīn min nafaḥātihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah fī 26 Rabīʻī [Rabīʻ] al-Thānī min shuhūr sanat 1071, ghafara Allāh li-nāẓimihā wa-lil-muʼminīn wa-al-muʼmināt wa-al-Muslimīn wa-al-Muslimāt al-aḥyāʼ minhum wa-al-amwāt. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon of "ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid": "The treatise was concluded by the praise of God, his help and his abundant benevolence, by the hand of the poorest and weakest of the servants al-Shaykh Qāsim ibn al-marḥūm al-Shaykh al-fāḍil ḥāwī al-faḍāʼil al-Shaykh ʻAlī Fayyāḍ al-Balqaṭrī baladan al-Mālikī madhhaban, may God forgive him and his parents and them who invoke God on his behalf to forgive him. May God forgive also the readers and listeners and all Muslims. Concluded is the copying of "al-Muqaddimah al-Rāʼīyah" on the orthography of the glorious Qurʼan, by Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Shāṭibī, May God benefit us by his blessings and encompass us by his grace in this world and in the hereafter, on 26 Rabīʻ al-Thānī, 1071. May God forgive its author and all believers, men and women, and all Muslims, men and women, the living among them and the dead. Amen. Amen. Amen."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note_text: Colophon of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "Tammat bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ʻawnih wa-ḥusn tawfīqih. Kātib al-khaṭṭ Muṣṭafá ibn Qāsim, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayh wa-li-jamīʻ ..."

title: 880-02 ʻAqīlat atrāb al-qaṣāʼid fī asná al-maqāṣid : manuscript / al-Qāsim ibn Fīrruh al-Shāṭibī al-Ruʻaynī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon of "Mukhtaṣar fī tajwīd al-Qurʼān al-ʻaẓīm": "The copying of the treatise was concluded by the praise of God, his help and his abundant benevolence, by Muṣṭafá ibn Qāsim, May God forgive him and his parents and all ..."

title: 880-02 Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik : manuscript / Jalāl al-Dīn al-Suyūṭī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Tazyīn al-mamālik bi-manāqib al-Imām Mālik raḍiya Allāh ʻanhu taʼlīf Sayyidinā wa-Mawlānā ʻAbd al-Raḥmān Jalāl al-Dīn ibn al-Shaykh al-ʻAllāmah Abī Bakr al-Suyūṭī al-Shāfiʻī taghammadahu Allāh taʻālá bi-raḥmatih wa-nafaʻanā bi-barakatih. Āmīn." "Wa-yalīhi Inbāh al-adhkiyāʼ bi-ḥayāt al-anbiyāʼ la-hu ayḍan. Wa-yalīhi Bushrá al-labīb bi-liqāʼ al-ḥabīb la-hu ayḍan." (These two titles are not in the present manuscript).

title: 880-02 Kifāyat al-muḥtāj fī qiṣṣat al-isrāʼ wa-al-miʻrāj : manuscript / Yūsuf Fakhr.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālat Kifāyat al-muḥtāj fī qiṣṣat al-Isrāʼ wa-al-miʻrāj taʼlīf al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah wa-al-ḥabr al-baḥr waḥīd dahrih wa-farīd ʻaṣrih al-Imām al-muḥaqqiq wālidī wa-malādhī wa-sayyidī wa-sanadī al-Shaykh Yūsuf Fakhr raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá raḥmatan wāsiʻah. Āmīn. Āmīn. Āmīn. Wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Tamm."

title: 880-02 Kifāyat al-muḥtāj fī qiṣṣat al-isrāʼ wa-al-miʻrāj : manuscript / Yūsuf Fakhr.
note_text: On folio 1b: "Lakhkhaṣtuhā min 'Qiṣṣat al-Isrāʼ' lil-ʻĀrif al-Ghayṭī muḥyī al-Sunnah."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Jurjānī ʻalá Kashshāf al-Zamakhsharī : manuscript / al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "al-ʻAllāmah al-Sayyid. Hādhihi Ḥāshiyat al-Sharīf ʻalá al-Kashshāf lil-ʻAllāmah al-Zamakhsharī, raḥmahumā Allāh taʻālá. Āmīn." "Ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid ʻalá al-Kashshāf." "Ḥāshiyat al-Sharīf ʻalá al-Kashshāf, nimrah 109."

title: 880-02 Ḥāshiyat al-Jurjānī ʻalá Kashshāf al-Zamakhsharī : manuscript / al-Sayyid al-Sharīf al-Jurjānī.
note_text: On spine: "Ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid ʻalá al-Kashshāf." "Tafsīr. Ḥāshiyat al-Sayyid al-Sharīf ʻalá al-Kashshāf." "Nūr al-Dīn Bik Muṣṭafá."

title: 880-02 Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ : manuscript / Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi risālah tusammá Nuzʹhat al-arwāḥ fī baʻḍ awṣāf al-Jannah dār al-afrāḥ lil-Shaykh Yūsuf ibn Saʻīd al-Ṣafatī al-Mālikī al-Azʹharī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-hi wa-bi-ʻulūmihi fī al-dunyā wa-al-ākhirah wa-al-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn. Āmīn."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhā Kitāb Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh li-Mawlānā al-Shaykh al-Akbar Sayyidī Muḥyī al-Dīn ibn ʻArabī, raḍiya Allāh taʻālá ʻanhu wa-ʻannā bi-hi. Āmīn. M."

title: 880-02 Kunh mā lā budda lil-murīd minh : manuscript / Ibn al-ʻArabī.
note_text: On folio 8a: "al-Itʹḥāfāt al-sanīyah bi-al-Aḥādīth al-Qudsīyah lil-ʻAllāmah al-Munāwī nafaʻanā Allāh bi-barakātihi wa-barakāt ʻulūmihi. Āmīn. M."

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note_text: On folio 1a: "Hādhihi Risālat al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān li-ʻIzz al-Dīn Bik ʻAlī Maʼmūr Mālīyat Dunqulah ḥafiẓahu [Allāh] wa-aʻānahu wa-fataḥa ʻalayh. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallama taslīman kathīran. Tamm."

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note_text: On folio 9b: 1. A poem in praise of the treatise by "Ḥaḍrat al-ʻĀlim al-shahīr Mawlānā al-Shaykh ʻAlī Ḥusayn al-Bulāqī [probably, al-Shaykh ʻAlī ibn Ḥusayn al-Masraʻī al-maʻrūf bi-al-Būlāqī who was alive 1307/1890]." 2. A poem by al-Shaykh ʻAbd al-Majīd al-Ghubāshī al-Azʹharī (could not be identified) praising the treatise and dating it in alphabetical reckoning (ḥsāb al-jummal): Halimmū ilayhā wa-iqraʼūhā wa-arrikhū // Zahat bi-bahāʼ al-ṭabʻi tilka al-Farāʼidu. 324."

title: 880-02 al-Farāʼid al-ḥisān fī ʻaqāʼid ahl al-īmān : manuscript / ʻIzz al-Dīn ibn ʻAlī al-Ṭanūbī al-Mālikī al-Ashʻarī.
note_text: On folio 10a: A short invocation in a different hand.

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note_text: Author's colophon: "Wa-kāna farāghī min taswīd hādhā al-mujallad al-awwal min Sharḥ Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, raḥimahu Allāh taʻālá, fī yawm al-Sabt sābiʻ wa-ʻishrīn min Dhī al-Qaʻdah sanat 1234 bi-Makkah al-Musharrafah qubayla al-ʻaṣr. Jaʻalahu Allāh min al-aʻmāl al-maqbūlah wa-waffaqanī li-itmām sharḥihi fī aqrab al-awqāt. Kutiba bi-qalam muʼallifihi Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Anṣārī al-Sindī, ghafara Allāh taʻālá la-hu wa-li-aslāfihi wa-mashāyikhihi wa-muḥibbīhi wa-jamīʻ aqāribih bi-faḍlihi wa-karamih. Āmīn. Wa-ghafara li-kātibihi wa-li-wālidayhi wa-li-man ṭālaʻahu wa-lil-Muslimīn ajmaʻīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi ajmaʻīn wa-sallama taslīman kathīran."

title: 880-02 al-Muʻtamad al-almaʻī al-mudhahhab fī ḥall Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī al-murattab. Al-Mujallad 1 : manuscript / Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Sindī.
note_text: Translation of the author's colophon: "The writing of the first volume of Sharḥ Musnad al-Imām al-Shāfiʻī, May God have mercy upon him, was finished on Saturday, 27 Dhū al-Qaʻdah, 1234 in Mecca, before the afternoon, May God render it an acceptable work and may He grant me the ability to complete the commentary as soon as possible. Written by its author Muḥammad ʻĀbid ibn Aḥmad ʻAlī al-Anṣārī al-Sindī, May God, the Most High, forgive him, his ancestors, his teachers, his beloved ones and all Muslims, by his grace and generosity. Amen. May God also forgive its copyist, his parents, those who read it and all Muslims. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, his family and all his companions and grant them abundant peace."

title: 880-03 al-Adhkār al-Nawawīyah, aw, Ḥilyat al-abrār wa-shiʻār al-akhyār fī talkhīṣ al-daʻawāt wa-al-adhkār al-mustaḥabbah fī al-layl wa-al-nahār : manuscript / Yaḥyá ibn Sharaf al-Nawawī.
note_text: Colophon: The last page is damaged; text ends with: "... aw ghalaṭ, wa-huwa mukhālif lil-kitāb wa-al-Sunnah wa-naṣṣ Imāmunā [al-Shāfiʻī] ..."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Ḥizb al-Nawawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī.
note_text: Colophon: "Qāla muʼallifuhu ʻabd Allāh taʻālá al-faqīr ilá ʻafwihi wa-maghfiratih Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī thumma al-Madanī kāna Allāh la-hu wa-jaʻalahu mimman lil-wilāyah ahlah: Wāfaqa al-farāgh minhu ḍaḥwat al-Ithnayn al-tāsiʻ min Ṣafar al-Khayr ʻām ithnayn wa-khamsīn wa-miʼah wa-alf bi-manzilī bi-al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah taḥta al-Manārah al-Sulaymānīyah min al-Masjid al-Sharīf ṣallá Allāh ʻalá musharrifihi wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam wa-al-ḥamdu lillāh waḥdah."

title: 880-02 Sharḥ Ḥizb al-Nawawī : manuscript / Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "Its author, the servant of God who is in need of His pardon and forgiveness, Muḥammad ibn al-Ṭayyib ibn Muḥammad al-Fāsī al-Madanī, May God be on his side and make him worthy of the Sufi status (wilāyah) said: The book was finished on Monday morning, the ninth of Ṣafar, the year 1152 at my home in al-Madīnah al-Munawwarah under the Sulaymānīyah Minaret of al-Masjid al-Sharīf, May God pray on Him who had honored it by His presence, and on his family and companions and grant them peace. Praise be to God alone."

title: Selections from the Qurʼan and invocations in Arabic and Ottoman Turkish : manuscript.
note_text: Starts with part of verse 11 of Sūrat Yāsīn (folio 3a): "... al-dhikr wa-khashiya al-Raḥmān bi-al-ghayb fa-bashshirhu bi-maghfiratin wa-ajrin karīm. Innā naḥnu nuḥyī al-mawtá wa-naktubu mā qaddamū wa-āthārahum wa-kulla shayʼin aḥṣaynāhu fī imāmin mubīn ..."

title: Missal : use of Sarum.
note_text: Music: music with square notes on a 4-line red staff.

title: Bible in shorthand : manuscript.
note_text: Opening page contains 10 small ink illustrations and is dated 1672. The opening page to the New Testament is dated 1673.

title: 880-02 Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī.
note_text: Incipit (folio 4b): "Bismillāh al-Raḥmān al-Raḥīm. "al-Ḥamdu lillāh Rabb al-ʻĀlamīn, wa-al-ʻāqibah lil-muttaqīn, wa-al-ṣalāh ʻalá Rasūlihi al-Muṣṭafá Muḥammad wa-ālihi al-ṭayyibīn al-ṭāhirīn ajmaʻīn. Kitāb al-Ṭahārāt. al-Ṭahārah fī al-lughah ʻibārah ʻan al-naẓāfah, wa-fī al-Sharīʻah, ʻibārah ʻan ghasl aʻḍāʼ makhṣūṣah bi-ṣifah makhṣūṣah, wa-hiya anwāʻ: Ṭahārat al-ṣughrá wa-Ṭahārat al-kubrá, wa-hiya ṭahārah ʻan al-ḥadath, wa-ṭahārat al-thawb wa-al-badan, wa-hiya ṭahārah ʻan al-khabath. Bāb mā yajūzu bi-hi al-wuḍūʼ, wa-mā lā yajūz. Faṣl fī al-miyāh ..."

title: 880-02 Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī.
note_text: Text ends abruptly on folio 276b, as follows: "... rawá al-Ḍaḥḥāk ʻan Ibn ʻAbbās, rḍ, annahu qāl: Yakūnu baʻd al-Nabī nūr yukanná Abū Ḥ, yaḥya dīn Allāh wa-Sunnat Rasūl Allāh ʻalá yadih. Wa-ʻan Anas, qāl, qāla Rasūl Allāh, ṣallá Allāh ʻalayhi wa-sallam: Yakūnu fī ākhir al-zamān rajul yukanná bi-Abī Ḥanīfah, yaḥyá dīn Allāh taʻālá wa-Sunnatī ʻalá yadih. Thumma shurrifa bi-al-dhikr fī Ḥadīth ākhar: Muliʼa qalbuhu ʻilman wa-ḥikmah ..."

title: 880-02 Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī.
note_text: Colophon (at the lower right margin of folio 276b): "Tammat al-kitāb, bi-ʻawn al-Malik al-Wahhāb, ʻalá yad ʻAbd [al-ʻabd] al-ḍaʻīf, al-muḥtāj, al-faqīr ilá Allāh al-Ghanī, Muḥammad ibn Mawlānā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mawlānā Qāsim, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi, wa-aḥsana ilayhimā wa-ilayhi. Tārīkhuhu sanat thalāthīn wa-tisʻimiʼah."

title: 880-02 Mukhtārāt al-nawāzil : manuscript / ʻAlī ibn Abī Bakr al-Marghīnānī.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "The book is completed by the help of the Abundant Giving King, by the hand of the feeble, needy and poor to Gracious God, Muḥammad ibn Mawlānā ʻAbd Allāh ibn Mawlānā Qāsim, may God forgive him and his parents and treat them and him favorably. Dated in the year 930 [of the Hijrah = 1523/1524]."

title: 880-02 al-Wasīlah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Hāʼim.
note_text: Colophon: "Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Wa-fī hādhā al-qadr alladhī awradtuhu kifāyah li-man ʻarafahu. Wa-man arāda al-tabaḥḥur fī hādhā al-fann, wa-al-wuqūf ʻalá mā yashfī al-ghalīl, fa-ʻalayhi bi-al-Maʻūnah. Wa-faragha min taswīdihā muʼallifuhā fī al-thāmin wa-al-ʻishrīn min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat 793. Wa-Allāh aʻlam. Tammat ʻalá yad Khalīl ibn Aḥmad al-Shabrāwī al-Madābighī, sanat 1198. M M M."

title: 880-02 al-Wasīlah : manuscript / Aḥmad ibn Muḥammad ibn al-Hāʼim.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "God is more knowledgeable. What I introduced here is enough for him who masters it. However, if someone wants to delve into this art and aquire what satiates his thirst, he should study 'al-Maʻūnah'. The author finished writing the draft on 28 Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 793 of the Hijrah [12 April, 1391]. God is more knowledgeable. Copied by Khalīl ibn Aḥmad al-Shabrāwī al-Madābighī, in the year 1198 [of the Hijrah = 1783/1784]. M M M."

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note_text: Colophon: "Wa-hādhā ākhir mā katabahu al-Faqīh Ibn Khaldūn. Intahá bi-ḥamd Allāh wa-ḥusn ʻawnih wa-tawfīqhi kitāb Muqaddiamt al-Shaykh al-Faqīh, al-ʻālim al-ʻallāmah, farīd ʻaṣrih wa-waḥīd dahrih, Ibn Khaldūn, raḥimahu Allāh wa-taghammadahu bi-raḥmatih, wa-aʻāda ʻalá al-Muslimīn min barakātih. Āmīn. Bi-jāh Sayyid al-Awwalīn wa-al-Ākharīn, Sayyidinā Muḥammad, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm, ʻalá yad al-faqīr ilá raḥmat Rabbihi al-qadīr, al-muʻtarf bi-al-ʻajz wa-al-taqṣīr, ʻAlī Muḥammad al-Mālikī, ghafara Allāh la-hu wa-li-wālidayhi wa-al-Muslimīn. Āmīn. Wa-ṣallá Allāh ʻalá Sayyidinā Muḥammad, wa-ʻalá ālihi wa-ṣaḥbihi wa-sallam. Wa-kāna al-farāgh min naskh hādhā al-juzʼ al-mubārak yawm al-Khamīs al-mubārak, sabʻata ʻashar yawman khalat [rubbamā baqiyat] min shahr Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, sanat 1270 min Hijratihi, ʻalayhi afḍal al-ṣalāh wa-al-taslīm."

title: 880-03 al-Muqaddimah : manuscript / Ibn Khaldūn.
note_text: Translation of the colophon: "This is the end of what was written by the Scholar Ibn Khaldūn. Completed, by the praise of God and His help and abundant benevolence, is the book of 'al-Muqaddimah' of the learned scholar, the unique in his time and age, Ibn Khaldūn, may God have mercy upon him, shield him with His compassion and bestow upon the Muslims of his blessings. Amen. By the intercession of the Master of the Former and the Latter, our Master Muḥammad, may the best prayer and peace be upon him. Copied by the hand of the poor to the mercy of his Mighty Lord, he who admits his disability and inefficiency, ʻAlī Muḥammad al-Mālikī, may God forgive him, his parents and the Muslims. Amen. May God pray on our Master Muḥammad, on his family and companions and grant them peace. The copy of this blessed part was completed on blessed Thursday, seventeen days having passed [probably remaining] of the month of Rabīʻ al-Ākhir, 1270 of the Hijrah of the Prophet [12 January, 1854], may the best prayer and peace be upon him."
